user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish:
```c
void
MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish (void)
{
#ifdef HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME
  if (_MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV != mono_clock_service)
  {
    mach_port_deallocate (mach_task_self (),
                          mono_clock_service);
    mono_clock_service = _MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV;
  }
#endif /* HAVE_CLOCK_GET_TIME */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (_MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV != mono_clock_service)
  {
    mach_port_deallocate (mach_task_self (),
                          mono_clock_service);
    mono_clock_service = _MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the provided fragment as written. The if-body is reachable whenever mono_clock_service != _MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV. A concrete violation scenario would be if mono_clock_service is a compile-time constant (or macro) that is always equal to _MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV (for example both expand to the same constant) or prior code guarantees mono_clock_service == _MHD_INVALID_CLOCK_SERV on every path; in that case the then-branch would be unreachable and Rule 2.1 would be violated.
